title: Reporting Analyst at Fella Health (Remote, $18.5k/yr - $25k/yr + equity)
description:
About Fella Health

Fella Health helps middle-aged men live 10 years longer.

We are the telemedicine clinic for bigger guys, worldwide. We use medical weight loss treatment to solve our fellas' most pressing healthcare need, then remain a fella's core healthcare provider for the rest of their life - focused on men's health, longevity, mental health, and primary care.

We will have served 1 million fellas by the end of 2026, and 10 million fellas by the end of 2028.

Our mission is to solve male obesity worldwide, by accelerating the take-up of GLP-1s in middle-aged men. From this, we‚Äôll become the world‚Äôs leading men‚Äôs health brand.

. We have expanded our state coverage to >95% of US population, have started to expand our clinical protocol beyond weight (e.g. testosterone), and are eyeing up international expansion.

We're still a young startup and are moving quickly. We have a way to go. This is still Day 1.

You can read more about working at Fella here: https://fella.notion.site/Working-at-Fella-14a2ac8575d34d148d009bb410387af4





The opportunity as

Fella Health is building a world-class team.

As the Reporting Analyst at Fella Health, you'll work closely with our operations team and other key stakeholders to deliver accurate, insightful data analysis and reporting that drives informed decision-making across the organization.

You'll take ownership of developing and maintaining a robust reporting framework, ensuring all teams have access to the data they need to drive success. Your primary focus will be supporting the operations team by analyzing patient data, tracking medication delivery times, and monitoring other key performance indicators. You'll also provide data support to other teams, such as growth, by working with data from ad platforms and sales.

As our data needs evolve, you'll continuously assess our data infrastructure and reporting processes, recommending and implementing enhancements that improve data accuracy, reliability, and accessibility. You'll stay up-to-date with the latest trends in data analysis and proactively identify opportunities to leverage new tools and technologies to drive business value.

Throughout your work, you'll maintain a proactive, solution-oriented approach, leveraging your expertise in big data, data warehouses, and scripting languages like SQL and Python to develop innovative solutions to complex data challenges. You'll be a trusted partner and advisor to teams across the organization, providing guidance and support to help them make data-driven decisions that drive success.

This is a full-time remote role.

You'll report directly to our Head of Ops, as well as work closely with our CEO (Richie Cartwright).

Key Responsibilities







- Work closely with the operations team to understand their data requirements, develop custom reports and dashboards, and provide ongoing support to help them make data-driven decisions that optimize processes and improve patient outcomes.

- Partner with other teams, such as growth and product, to provide data analysis and reporting support. Help them identify key metrics, develop reporting templates, and provide regular performance updates that drive actionable insights.



- Continuously assess our data management and reporting infrastructure, recommending and implementing enhancements that improve data accuracy, reliability, and accessibility. Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in data management and reporting.

- Create a comprehensive library of self-service reporting resources, including data dictionaries, query templates, and training materials. Empower teams across the organization to access and analyze data independently, with guidance and support from the reporting team.

- Work with our data science team to implement advanced analytics and machine learning techniques that uncover deeper insights and drive predictive and prescriptive decision-making. Collaborate with stakeholders to identify high-impact use cases and develop actionable solutions.

- Promote a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization, providing training and support to help teams leverage data effectively. Host regular data reviews and workshops to share insights, best practices, and success stories, and to identify new opportunities for data-driven innovation.

Need to have



Nice to have



Our cultural standards

These are the core cultural standards to which we hold ourselves & our team-members at Fella:



🎯 a poetic extract from one of our advisors.

Here, we‚Äôre committed to building a more diverse and inclusive workforce. Not only is it our responsibility to do better, but we also need representative voices to power the fresh thinking that is vital for our business and our clients.



This is a permanent full-time role based in Bonifacio Global City, Taguig following a hybrid work model setup (at least 2 in office days per week).

You can expect an autonomous but fast-paced work environment where you are recognized for your results and ability to drive things forward. Every day brings many opportunities to learn & grow and rewards with a global impact we create.

In return, you will receive HMO coverage for you and your dependents, employee stock purchase plan, equity grant, retirement plan, annual bonus, free counseling sessions, subscription to e-learning platforms, fitness, wellness and more.



We are seeking a meticulous and diligent to join the Financial Technology Go-to-Market marketing team. The main responsibility of this role will be to capture and cleanse data that drives marketing campaigns and initiatives, contributing to significant pipeline generation across the sales organisation. This includes cleansing existing data within our Salesforce CRM system as well as new data aggregation.

This position requires an individual who can ensure that our CRM data is accurately tagged for targeting and reporting. The Data Analyst will play a crucial role in building out target accounts and people and tagging them appropriately. One of the key skills required is a familiarity with AI tools and agents and know how to employ these tools in data cleansing and enrichment.









Please follow through by clicking the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù link and submitting your application. If your skills and experience are a match, we will be in touch soon. In the meantime, please visit our website and social media channels to learn more about our innovative business, inclusive culture and discover why Nasdaq Manila is Great Place To Work certified!

title: Reporting Analyst at Fella Health (Remote, $18.5k/yr - $25k/yr + equity)
description:
About Fella Health

Fella Health helps middle-aged men live 10 years longer.

We are the telemedicine clinic for bigger guys, worldwide. We use medical weight loss treatment to solve our fellas' most pressing healthcare need, then remain a fella's core healthcare provider for the rest of their life - focused on men's health, longevity, mental health, and primary care.

We will have served 1 million fellas by the end of 2026, and 10 million fellas by the end of 2028.

Our mission is to solve male obesity worldwide, by accelerating the take-up of GLP-1s in middle-aged men. From this, we‚Äôll become the world‚Äôs leading men‚Äôs health brand.

. We have expanded our state coverage to >95% of US population, have started to expand our clinical protocol beyond weight (e.g. testosterone), and are eyeing up international expansion.

We're still a young startup and are moving quickly. We have a way to go. This is still Day 1.

You can read more about working at Fella here: https://fella.notion.site/Working-at-Fella-14a2ac8575d34d148d009bb410387af4





The opportunity as

Fella Health is building a world-class team.

As the Reporting Analyst at Fella Health, you'll work closely with our operations team and other key stakeholders to deliver accurate, insightful data analysis and reporting that drives informed decision-making across the organization.

You'll take ownership of developing and maintaining a robust reporting framework, ensuring all teams have access to the data they need to drive success. Your primary focus will be supporting the operations team by analyzing patient data, tracking medication delivery times, and monitoring other key performance indicators. You'll also provide data support to other teams, such as growth, by working with data from ad platforms and sales.

As our data needs evolve, you'll continuously assess our data infrastructure and reporting processes, recommending and implementing enhancements that improve data accuracy, reliability, and accessibility. You'll stay up-to-date with the latest trends in data analysis and proactively identify opportunities to leverage new tools and technologies to drive business value.

Throughout your work, you'll maintain a proactive, solution-oriented approach, leveraging your expertise in big data, data warehouses, and scripting languages like SQL and Python to develop innovative solutions to complex data challenges. You'll be a trusted partner and advisor to teams across the organization, providing guidance and support to help them make data-driven decisions that drive success.

This is a full-time remote role.

You'll report directly to our Head of Ops, as well as work closely with our CEO (Richie Cartwright).

Key Responsibilities







- Work closely with the operations team to understand their data requirements, develop custom reports and dashboards, and provide ongoing support to help them make data-driven decisions that optimize processes and improve patient outcomes.

- Partner with other teams, such as growth and product, to provide data analysis and reporting support. Help them identify key metrics, develop reporting templates, and provide regular performance updates that drive actionable insights.



- Continuously assess our data management and reporting infrastructure, recommending and implementing enhancements that improve data accuracy, reliability, and accessibility. Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in data management and reporting.

- Create a comprehensive library of self-service reporting resources, including data dictionaries, query templates, and training materials. Empower teams across the organization to access and analyze data independently, with guidance and support from the reporting team.

- Work with our data science team to implement advanced analytics and machine learning techniques that uncover deeper insights and drive predictive and prescriptive decision-making. Collaborate with stakeholders to identify high-impact use cases and develop actionable solutions.

- Promote a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization, providing training and support to help teams leverage data effectively. Host regular data reviews and workshops to share insights, best practices, and success stories, and to identify new opportunities for data-driven innovation.

Need to have



Nice to have



Our cultural standards

These are the core cultural standards to which we hold ourselves & our team-members at Fella:



🎯 a poetic extract from one of our advisors.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Services
About Us
Careers


DevOps Engineer

Back to Careers

Role Overview



We are seeking a skilled and proactive DevOps Engineer to design, implement, and manage scalable, secure, and reliable cloud infrastructure. You will play a critical role in automating deployment pipelines, managing cloud resources, and supporting development teams in delivering high-quality software at speed and scale.



Design, deploy, and manage cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, or GCP).

Develop and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform, CloudFormation, or similar tools.

Build, maintain, and optimize CI/CD pipelines (e.g., GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins).

Automate operational processes and improve system observability (monitoring, logging, alerting).

Ensure cloud architectures are cost-effective, secure, and compliant with best practices.

Manage containerized applications using Kubernetes, ECS, or EKS.

Implement backup, recovery, and disaster recovery strategies.

Collaborate with development teams for release management and incident response.

Stay up to date on cloud technologies, proposing improvements as needed.



3+ years of experience in a DevOps, Cloud Engineering, or Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) role.

Strong expertise in AWS (preferred), Azure, or GCP services (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, etc.).

Proficiency in IaC tools like Terraform or AWS CloudFormation.

Experience with container orchestration (Kubernetes, EKS, GKE, or AKS).

Familiarity with Linux system administration and shell scripting.

Good understanding of networking concepts (VPCs, Load Balancers, VPNs).

Knowledge of security practices (IAM, Secrets Management, Encryption).

Experience with monitoring and logging tools (CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, ELK).

Programming/scripting knowledge (Python, Bash, or Go is a plus).



AWS Certified DevOps Engineer or similar cloud certifications.



Background in Agile methodologies and DevSecOps practices.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Services
About Us
Careers


DevOps Engineer

Back to Careers

Role Overview



We are seeking a skilled and proactive DevOps Engineer to design, implement, and manage scalable, secure, and reliable cloud infrastructure. You will play a critical role in automating deployment pipelines, managing cloud resources, and supporting development teams in delivering high-quality software at speed and scale.



Design, deploy, and manage cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, or GCP).

Develop and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform, CloudFormation, or similar tools.

Build, maintain, and optimize CI/CD pipelines (e.g., GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins).

Automate operational processes and improve system observability (monitoring, logging, alerting).

Ensure cloud architectures are cost-effective, secure, and compliant with best practices.

Manage containerized applications using Kubernetes, ECS, or EKS.

Implement backup, recovery, and disaster recovery strategies.

Collaborate with development teams for release management and incident response.

Stay up to date on cloud technologies, proposing improvements as needed.



3+ years of experience in a DevOps, Cloud Engineering, or Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) role.

Strong expertise in AWS (preferred), Azure, or GCP services (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, etc.).

Proficiency in IaC tools like Terraform or AWS CloudFormation.

Experience with container orchestration (Kubernetes, EKS, GKE, or AKS).

Familiarity with Linux system administration and shell scripting.

Good understanding of networking concepts (VPCs, Load Balancers, VPNs).

Knowledge of security practices (IAM, Secrets Management, Encryption).

Experience with monitoring and logging tools (CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, ELK).

Programming/scripting knowledge (Python, Bash, or Go is a plus).



AWS Certified DevOps Engineer or similar cloud certifications.



Background in Agile methodologies and DevSecOps practices.



Use this space to promote the business, its products or its services. Help people become familiar with the business and its offerings, creating a sense of connection and trust. Focus on what makes the business unique and how users can benefit from choosing it.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Services
About Us
Careers


DevOps Engineer

Back to Careers

Role Overview



We are seeking a skilled and proactive DevOps Engineer to design, implement, and manage scalable, secure, and reliable cloud infrastructure. You will play a critical role in automating deployment pipelines, managing cloud resources, and supporting development teams in delivering high-quality software at speed and scale.



Design, deploy, and manage cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, or GCP).

Develop and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform, CloudFormation, or similar tools.

Build, maintain, and optimize CI/CD pipelines (e.g., GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins).

Automate operational processes and improve system observability (monitoring, logging, alerting).

Ensure cloud architectures are cost-effective, secure, and compliant with best practices.

Manage containerized applications using Kubernetes, ECS, or EKS.

Implement backup, recovery, and disaster recovery strategies.

Collaborate with development teams for release management and incident response.

Stay up to date on cloud technologies, proposing improvements as needed.



3+ years of experience in a DevOps, Cloud Engineering, or Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) role.

Strong expertise in AWS (preferred), Azure, or GCP services (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, etc.).

Proficiency in IaC tools like Terraform or AWS CloudFormation.

Experience with container orchestration (Kubernetes, EKS, GKE, or AKS).

Familiarity with Linux system administration and shell scripting.

Good understanding of networking concepts (VPCs, Load Balancers, VPNs).

Knowledge of security practices (IAM, Secrets Management, Encryption).

Experience with monitoring and logging tools (CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, ELK).

Programming/scripting knowledge (Python, Bash, or Go is a plus).



AWS Certified DevOps Engineer or similar cloud certifications.



Background in Agile methodologies and DevSecOps practices.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Things To Know Before Applying

you must have your own work equipment

you are able to work remotely

you can work full-time for this role

experience working with clients/companies outside PH is an advantage

Position Overview

We are seeking a highly skilled Full Stack Developer with strong expertise in Python (Django framework) for backend development and Next.js / React.js/ React Native for frontend development. The ideal candidate should be able to build scalable, efficient, and user-friendly applications, with a strong grasp of modern web technologies. Excellent English communication skills are a must, as the role involves close collaboration with cross-functional teams and clients. Prior experience in booking system projects will be considered a strong advantage.

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain scalable backend systems using Python and Django.

Build and optimize frontend applications using Next.js and React.js.

Collaborate with UI/UX designers to deliver high-quality user experiences.

Integrate APIs and third-party services for seamless functionality.

Write clean, maintainable, and testable code following best practices.

Troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade existing systems as needed.

Participate in code reviews and contribute to continuous improvement.

Communicate effectively with internal teams and clients to understand requirements and deliver solutions.



Proven work experience as a Full Stack Developer.

Strong knowledge of Python and the Django framework.

Proficiency in Next.js and React.js for frontend development.

Understanding of relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and ORM concepts.

Experience with REST APIs and/or GraphQL.

Solid understanding of version control (Git).

Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Excellent verbal and written English communication skills.

Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.



Experience working on booking system projects (appointment scheduling, ticketing, reservations, etc.).

Knowledge of deployment on AWS, Azure, or other cloud platforms.

Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).

title: Junior JavaScript Developer
description:
About Tort Experts

At Tort Experts, we are redefining the landscape of performance marketing in the legal sector. Our mission is to democratize access to information for individuals who have been injured, connecting them with law firms that can truly advocate for their rights and achieve successful outcomes. As an innovative, vertically integrated legal case acquisition marketing company, we leverage cutting-edge technology, data-driven insights, and a commitment to transparency to disrupt the status quo.

Joining Tort Experts means becoming part of a dynamic team that is passionate about making a meaningful impact. We foster a collaborative environment where creativity thrives, and every team member plays a vital role in connecting qualified claimants with the representation they deserve. If you‚Äôre looking for a workplace where your contributions can truly make a difference, and where innovation meets purpose, Tort Experts is the perfect place for you.



We are looking for a versatile junior full stack developer, who has a love for JavaScript, to help across multiple business areas building tools to help team members accomplish their tasks more accurately and efficiently. Specifically you will build and maintain React components for our lead generation landing pages. Our websites are hosted by Vercel with Builder.io as the content management system of a WYSIWYG website builder. The candidate would have responsibility for administration and operation of the full web publishing system.

Additionally, we have a suite of internal applications built on the Retool platform. We are looking for someone to take the lead on developing and maintaining these applications.

Finally, there will be a need to write clean html, css, and standard JS for quick website fixes with on website forms. This is not a design job but you should be able to update code to match designs.

We have a small but very powerful and agile technology team that is building some amazing tools that help the company grow at a fast pace.














At Tort Experts, we believe in empowering our team members with growth opportunities, a flexible work environment, and the chance to make a tangible impact. If you thrive in fast-paced environments and are driven, client-focused, and eager to contribute to our mission of connecting clients with top-tier legal representation. Are you ready to lead the next wave of growth in legal marketing? Apply today and help us transform access to justice!

title: Front-end Developer
description:
Services


Front-end Developer

Back to Careers

Role Overview



We are seeking a skilled and creative Front-end Developer to help build intuitive, responsive, and visually engaging user interfaces. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to transform ideas into seamless digital experiences, with a strong focus on performance, accessibility, and cross-platform compatibility.



Design, develop, and maintain user interfaces that are visually appealing, intuitive, and responsive.

Build reusable components and front-end libraries for future use.

Ensure high performance, high quality, and scalability of UI applications.

Collaborate with backend developers to integrate RESTful APIs and ensure seamless data flows.

Continuously stay up to date with the latest front-end technologies and industry trends to maintain best practices.

Debug and troubleshoot UI issues, ensuring a smooth user experience across browsers and devices.

Work closely with UX/UI designers to translate wireframes and designs into high-quality code.

Optimize components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.

Participate in code reviews to maintain high code quality standards.



3+ years of experience in front-end development using React.js, Vue.js, and JavaScript.

Strong proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, and modern front-end build pipelines and tools such as Webpack, Babel, etc.

Experience with Node.js and integrating front-end code with RESTful services.

Solid understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.

Experience with state management libraries like Redux or Vuex.

Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git.

Knowledge of UI/UX best practices and the ability to collaborate with designers to implement their vision.

Familiarity with responsive design principles and frameworks like Bootstrap or Tailwind CSS.

Exposure to Continuous Integration/Delivery pipelines (Jenkins, Docker, etc.).

Knowledge of testing frameworks such as Jest, Mocha, or Cypress is a plus.



Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.

Proficient in JavaScript, React.js, Vue.js, and Node.js.

Strong understanding of CSS frameworks and preprocessors like SASS or LESS.

Concrete examples of successful web applications or UI components built.

A mix of technical and communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

title: Junior JavaScript Developer
description:
About Tort Experts

At Tort Experts, we are redefining the landscape of performance marketing in the legal sector. Our mission is to democratize access to information for individuals who have been injured, connecting them with law firms that can truly advocate for their rights and achieve successful outcomes. As an innovative, vertically integrated legal case acquisition marketing company, we leverage cutting-edge technology, data-driven insights, and a commitment to transparency to disrupt the status quo.

Joining Tort Experts means becoming part of a dynamic team that is passionate about making a meaningful impact. We foster a collaborative environment where creativity thrives, and every team member plays a vital role in connecting qualified claimants with the representation they deserve. If you‚Äôre looking for a workplace where your contributions can truly make a difference, and where innovation meets purpose, Tort Experts is the perfect place for you.



We are looking for a versatile junior full stack developer, who has a love for JavaScript, to help across multiple business areas building tools to help team members accomplish their tasks more accurately and efficiently. Specifically you will build and maintain React components for our lead generation landing pages. Our websites are hosted by Vercel with Builder.io as the content management system of a WYSIWYG website builder. The candidate would have responsibility for administration and operation of the full web publishing system.

Additionally, we have a suite of internal applications built on the Retool platform. We are looking for someone to take the lead on developing and maintaining these applications.

Finally, there will be a need to write clean html, css, and standard JS for quick website fixes with on website forms. This is not a design job but you should be able to update code to match designs.

We have a small but very powerful and agile technology team that is building some amazing tools that help the company grow at a fast pace.














At Tort Experts, we believe in empowering our team members with growth opportunities, a flexible work environment, and the chance to make a tangible impact. If you thrive in fast-paced environments and are driven, client-focused, and eager to contribute to our mission of connecting clients with top-tier legal representation. Are you ready to lead the next wave of growth in legal marketing? Apply today and help us transform access to justice!

title: Front-end Developer
description:
Services
About Us
Careers


Front-end Developer

Back to Careers

Role Overview



We are seeking a skilled and creative Front-end Developer to help build intuitive, responsive, and visually engaging user interfaces. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to transform ideas into seamless digital experiences, with a strong focus on performance, accessibility, and cross-platform compatibility.



Design, develop, and maintain user interfaces that are visually appealing, intuitive, and responsive.

Build reusable components and front-end libraries for future use.

Ensure high performance, high quality, and scalability of UI applications.

Collaborate with backend developers to integrate RESTful APIs and ensure seamless data flows.

Continuously stay up to date with the latest front-end technologies and industry trends to maintain best practices.

Debug and troubleshoot UI issues, ensuring a smooth user experience across browsers and devices.

Work closely with UX/UI designers to translate wireframes and designs into high-quality code.

Optimize components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers.

Participate in code reviews to maintain high code quality standards.



3+ years of experience in front-end development using React.js, Vue.js, and JavaScript.

Strong proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, and modern front-end build pipelines and tools such as Webpack, Babel, etc.

Experience with Node.js and integrating front-end code with RESTful services.

Solid understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them.

Experience with state management libraries like Redux or Vuex.

Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git.

Knowledge of UI/UX best practices and the ability to collaborate with designers to implement their vision.

Familiarity with responsive design principles and frameworks like Bootstrap or Tailwind CSS.

Exposure to Continuous Integration/Delivery pipelines (Jenkins, Docker, etc.).

Knowledge of testing frameworks such as Jest, Mocha, or Cypress is a plus.



Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.

Proficient in JavaScript, React.js, Vue.js, and Node.js.

Strong understanding of CSS frameworks and preprocessors like SASS or LESS.

Concrete examples of successful web applications or UI components built.

A mix of technical and communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.



Use this space to promote the business, its products or its services. Help people become familiar with the business and its offerings, creating a sense of connection and trust. Focus on what makes the business unique and how users can benefit from choosing it.

title: Junior JavaScript Developer
description:
About Tort Experts

At Tort Experts, we are redefining the landscape of performance marketing in the legal sector. Our mission is to democratize access to information for individuals who have been injured, connecting them with law firms that can truly advocate for their rights and achieve successful outcomes. As an innovative, vertically integrated legal case acquisition marketing company, we leverage cutting-edge technology, data-driven insights, and a commitment to transparency to disrupt the status quo.

Joining Tort Experts means becoming part of a dynamic team that is passionate about making a meaningful impact. We foster a collaborative environment where creativity thrives, and every team member plays a vital role in connecting qualified claimants with the representation they deserve. If you‚Äôre looking for a workplace where your contributions can truly make a difference, and where innovation meets purpose, Tort Experts is the perfect place for you.



We are looking for a versatile junior full stack developer, who has a love for JavaScript, to help across multiple business areas building tools to help team members accomplish their tasks more accurately and efficiently. Specifically you will build and maintain React components for our lead generation landing pages. Our websites are hosted by Vercel with Builder.io as the content management system of a WYSIWYG website builder. The candidate would have responsibility for administration and operation of the full web publishing system.

Additionally, we have a suite of internal applications built on the Retool platform. We are looking for someone to take the lead on developing and maintaining these applications.

Finally, there will be a need to write clean html, css, and standard JS for quick website fixes with on website forms. This is not a design job but you should be able to update code to match designs.

We have a small but very powerful and agile technology team that is building some amazing tools that help the company grow at a fast pace.














At Tort Experts, we believe in empowering our team members with growth opportunities, a flexible work environment, and the chance to make a tangible impact. If you thrive in fast-paced environments and are driven, client-focused, and eager to contribute to our mission of connecting clients with top-tier legal representation. Are you ready to lead the next wave of growth in legal marketing? Apply today and help us transform access to justice!

description:
Responsibilities

Responsibilities & Qualifications

The Full Stack Developer will design, build, and scale the user-facing and backend components of an agentic AI platform, enabling intuitive visibility into model and data governance, performance, and compliance. Individual developers will focus within a team environment on either UX / Front-End Development or Agentic Agent Integration.












We are seeking a to support National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency (NGA) Artificial Intelligence (AI) efforts. This developer will play an important role helping to create technical solutions for multiple AI challenges.

title: Data Scientist I, Data Science
description:
Company Description

At Western Digital, our vision is to power global innovation and push the boundaries of technology to make what you thought was once impossible, possible.

At our core, Western Digital is a company of problem solvers. People achieve extraordinary things given the right technology. For decades, we‚Äôve been doing just that‚Äîour technology helped people put a man on the moon and capture the first-ever picture of a black hole.

We offer an expansive portfolio of technologies, HDDs, and platforms for business, creative professionals, and consumers alike under our Western Digital¬Æ, WD¬Æ, WD_BLACK‚Ñ¢, and SanDisk¬Æ Professional brands.

We are a key partner to some of the largest and highest-growth organizations in the world. From enabling systems to make cities safer and more connected, to powering the data centers behind many of the world‚Äôs biggest companies and hyperscale cloud providers, to meeting the massive and ever-growing data storage needs of the AI era, Western Digital is fueling a brighter, smarter future.

Today‚Äôs exceptional challenges require your unique skills. Together, we can build the future of data storage.





As a you will be responsible for collecting and processing data from various sources, develop and deploy machine learning models and AI agents, and use generative AI to enhance data analysis. You‚Äôll work closely with cross-functional teams to solve business problems and ensure clear communication with stakeholders. The role also involves thorough documentation to support reproducibility and system maintenance.

title: Data Scientist (Country and Marketing Analytics)
description:
Company Description

About Grab and Our Workplace

Grab is Southeast Asia's leading superapp. From getting your favourite meals delivered to helping you manage your finances and getting around town hassle-free, we've got your back with everything. In Grab, purpose gives us joy and habits build excellence, while harnessing the power of Technology and AI to deliver the mission of driving Southeast Asia forward by economically empowering everyone, with heart, hunger, honour, and humility.





The Regional Data Science team is a dynamic and diverse group of problem-solvers who partner with different business verticals and markets across Grab. By leveraging data-driven insights, advanced analytics, and cutting-edge AI experimentation, the team helps unlock smarter decisions and innovative solutions that drive sustainable impact for our customers, driver-partners, and merchants. Rooted in collaboration and growth, the team continuously explores new ways to harness technology to power Grab's mission of driving Southeast Asia forward.



The team works with multiple teams in Grab - Business, Operations, Marketing but also Engineering, Product and other Data teams, to understand data requirements, identify metrics, and provide data-driven solutions that are tailored and to always-evolving innovation in our markets.















We care about your well-being at Grab, here are some of the global benefits we offer:





We are committed to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that enables diverse Grabbers to grow and perform at their best. As an equal opportunity employer, we consider all candidates fairly and equally regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, family commitments, physical and mental impairments or disabilities, and other attributes that make them unique.
